meanings.definition: Firmly established or difficult to change.

meanings.sent3: His hardset routine of eating ice cream before bed was both comforting and concerning.

meanings.definition: A firmly established or difficult to change attitude or belief.
meanings.sent1: His hardset on always being right often caused conflicts with his friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's hardset about the importance of education inspired her students.
meanings.sent3: The hardset that cats are better than dogs led to a playful debate at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her hardset on always wearing red made her stand out in a sea of black dresses.
meanings.sent5: The hardset of the community to recycle diligently helped the environment thrive.
